intro: Sisymbrium murale var. barrelieri, commonly known as the Barrelier's broomrape, is a parasitic plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It lacks chlorophyll and relies entirely on its host plant for nutrients, typically attaching itself to the roots of other species. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has a highly reduced morphology compared to its non-parasitic relatives. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. Due to its specialized lifestyle, it plays a unique role in its ecosystem as a parasite and a potential indicator of soil health.
